cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the construction of codes for distributed storage systems, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also involves the study of the repair properties of these codes, which can be seen as a problem in distributed systems (cs.DS). The paper proposes a generic transformation that can be applied to existing codes, which involves some algorithmic aspects (cs.NI). The paper also discusses the properties of the resultant codes, such as their sub-packetization and access properties, which can be seen as a problem in systems and networking (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the implications of the proposed transformation on the design of codes, which can be seen as a problem in complexity theory (cs.CC).
